summary: THE CLUTCH CABLE FRAYED AND NEARLY BROKE AT THE HANDLEBAR DURING A NORMAL UP-SHIFT FROM 2ND GEAR TO 3RD GEAR. HAD A FULL FAILURE OCCURRED THE TRANSMISSION WOULD HAVE BEEN COMPLETELY ENGAGED WITHOUT ANY RECOURSE.  THE FAILURE HAS OCCURRED TWICE BEFORE, ONCE LESS THAN A YEAR AGO, AND THE ONCE MORE THAN A YEAR PRIOR TO THE FIRST OCCURRENCE. THE MOTORCYCLE HAD APPROXIMATELY 48,000 MILES ON IT THE FIRST TIME, APPROXIMATELY 49,000 THE SECOND TIME, AND 52,000 MILES ON THE MOST RECENT TIME. EACH TIME THE FAILURE OCCURS ON THE CLUTCH BOWDEN CABLE (BMW P/N 32732324961 FOR A 2000 R1100R) WHERE THE BRAIDED WIRE MEETS THE MOLDED METAL RETAINER. IN THE PREVIOUS OCCURRENCES, FAILURE WAS OBVIOUS BUT MORE GRADUAL.  AN INDIVIDUAL AT THE GATEWAY BMW (ST. LOUIS) PARTS DESK INFORMED ME LAST TIME I BOUGHT A CLUTCH BOWDEN CABLE THAT BMW HAD BEEN HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THIS PARTICULAR PART.  *TR
